title: Fort Davis National Historic Site: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons         NPS Photo by Max Kandler      Open:8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Central Time  Holiday Closures:Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, New Year's Day, and Martin Luther King Jr. Holiday. Fee Free Days:    January 18:Martin Luther King Jr. Day April 16 through 24:National Park Week August 25 through 28:National Park Service Birthday September 24:National Public Lands Day  November 11:Veterans Day  Self-guided tours of restored and re-furnished buildings (Park Brochure); hiking (connecting with trails of adjacent Davis Mountain State Park); and a 15-minute video shown every half-hour. Pets on leash are permitted. Individual Fees $7.00- 7 Days Your Fee Dollars at Work.pdf Details Park Entrance fee is $7.00 per person for visitors 16 years and older. Children 15 and under are free. Group Visit Fees Thereare 3 options: $7.00 per person - 7 Days $15.00 per vehicle - 7 Days $10.00 per motorcycle - 7 Days  Details Fee for commercial groups is $7.00 per person age 16 and over. Educational groups may request a fee waiver in writing on school letterhead prior to visit. Entrance Passes Specific passes for free entrance to the park are honored and are also available at the Visitor Center. These include Senior (Golden Age), Access (Golden Access), Interagency Annual, Interagency Military and Fourth Grade passes.Click here for more information. Fort Davis NHS Annual Pass You can buy an annual pass to Fort Davis National Historic Site for $30.00. This pass will admit the pass owners and three other adults to the Fort for 12 months from the month of purchase. Special Park Uses & Filming/Photography Permits   Commercial filming permits are arranged on an individual basis.
